alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 12 at 4:50AM EST until January 12 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM CST FOR SOUTHEASTERN MASSAC...SOUTHEASTERN POPE...SOUTHERN LIVINGSTON AND NORTHWESTERN MARSHALL COUNTIES... At 350 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Calvert City, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. Golfball sized hail was reported in Reidland with this storm, and numerous other large hail reports are being recieved. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Calvert City, Ledbetter, Grand Rivers and Smithland. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 18 and 33. Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 48 and 51. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
